name: Navigate to word
starting: |The quick brown fox broke the sound barrier
target: The quick brown |fox broke the sound barrier
description: Move cursor to the start of the word 'fox'
hint: Use w to move forward by words

name: Move to end of line
starting: |The cursor is all the way to the left, let's move it to the end of the line
target: The cursor is all the way to the left, let's move it to the end of the line|
description: Move cursor to the end of the line
hint: Use $ to jump to the end of the line

name: Move to start of line
starting: This time the cursor is already at the end, let's move it to the start|
target: |This time the cursor is already at the end, let's move it to the start
description: Move cursor to the beginning of the line
hint: Use 0 to jump to the start of the line, or ^ to jump to the first non-whitespace character

name: Move backwards by word
starting: The quick brown fox|
description: Move cursor backwards to the word 'quick'
hint: Use b to move backwards by words. Count how many times you need to press b

name: Move to end of word
starting: |The quick brown fox
description: Move cursor to the end of the word 'The'
hint: Use e to move to the end of the current word

name: Navigate down lines
description: Move cursor down to the 'return' line
hint: Use j to move down lines, then use w or ^ to position the cursor correctly

name: Navigate to last line
starting:
|First line
Second line
Third line
Fourth line
Fifth line
target:
First line
Second line
Third line
Fourth line
|Fifth line
description: Jump to the last line
hint: Use G (capital G) to jump to the last line

name: Navigate to first line
starting:
First line
Second line
Third line
Fourth line
Fifth |line
target:
|First line
Second line
Third line
Fourth line
Fifth line
description: Jump to the first line
hint: Use gg to jump to the first line

name: Multi-line navigation
starting:
Start here x| and somehow needed
to make your way all the way towards
the end of this line to get here y
target:
Start here x and somehow needed
to make your way all the way towards
the end of this line to get here y|
description: Navigate from [x] at the beginning to [y] at the end across multiple lines
hint: Use G to jump to last line, then $ to move to end of line

name: Add exclamation
starting: Hello World
description: Add an exclamation mark at the end
hint: Use A to append at the end of the line, type !, then press Esc

name: Delete a word
starting: |The quick brown lazy fox
description: Delete the word 'lazy'
hint: Navigate to 'lazy' with w, then use dw to delete the word. Move to the end with $

name: Change word
starting: Hello |world
description: Change 'world' to 'universe'
hint: Using cw is a bit faster than dw since it clears the word and puts you in insert mode

name: Fix typo with insert mode
starting: |Fx the typo
description: Fix the typo 'Fx' to 'Fix' using insert mode
hint: Position on 'x', use i to enter insert mode, type 'i', then Esc

name: Fix typo with delete
starting: |Fixx the typo
description: Fix the typo 'Fixx' to 'Fix' using the x command
hint: Position on the extra 'x' using l or w, then press x to delete it

name: Add missing letter
starting: |Fix this line by adding the missing lette
target: Fix this line by adding the missing letter|
description: Add the missing 'r' at the end
hint: Use A to append at end of line, type 'r', then Esc

name: Delete multiple words
starting: VIM |IS LAME awesome and powerful
description: Delete the next 2 words 'IS LAME'
hint: Use d2w to delete 2 words, or use w to navigate then dw twice

name: Change quoted word
starting: Translate |"hola" to English
description: Change the word inside quotes from 'hola' to 'hello'
hint: Use ci" to change inside quotes, type 'hello', then Esc

name: Remove function arguments
starting: def |foo(bar, baz):
description: Remove the function arguments
hint: Use ci( to change inside parentheses, then immediately press Esc

name: Delete content in quotes
starting: Lincoln said "|Four score and seven years ago"
description: Delete what's inside the quotes
hint: Use di" to delete inside quotes

name: Remove python dict contents
description: Delete the dictionary using % to match brackets
hint: Curly brackets are text objects! Try di{

name: Append trademark symbols
starting:
Oreos*
Cookies
Gatorade*
Sports drink
Tissues
Kleenex*
target:
Oreos(Tm)
Cookies
Gatorade(Tm)
Sports drink
Tissues
Kleenex(Tm)
description: Replace each * with (Tm)
hint: Use f* to find *, then r( to replace with '(', then a to append, type 'Tm)', repeat with . for next one

name: Yank and paste with dot
starting:
First line
Second line
Third line
Fourth line
target:
First line

Second line

Third line

Fourth line
description: Add empty lines between all text lines
hint: Use O to insert line above, press Esc, use yy to yank empty line, move with j, use p to paste, repeat with j. for remaining lines

name: Delete words with capitals
starting: |Delete every worD on This liNe that haS A capital leTter
description: Delete each word that contains a capital letter
hint: Use dw to delete word, then w to skip lowercase word, use . to repeat delete on next capital word

name: Change upper/lowercase of all letters
starting: oH NO! tHE UPPER/LOWER CASE. iT IS COMPLETELY SWAPPED!
target: Oh no! The upper/lower case. It is completely swapped!
description: Case switching
hint: Kind of a gimmick since you're unlikely to be in this situation, but you can do this in Visual Line mode with ~

name: Change column
starting:
ACCD
ACCD
ACCD
ACCD
description: Change a column
hint: C-v to go into Visual Column mode then replace with r

name: Center Haiku
starting:
Whole seasons are spent
mastering the form, the style.
None calls it easy.
target:
----------------------------------
*    Whole seasons are spent     *
* mastering the form, the style. *
*      None calls it easy.       *
----------------------------------
description: Center a Haiku
hint: Use Visual Line mode replace for the header and footer.

name: Numbered list
starting:
- Iron Man
 - The Incredible Hulk
 - Iran Man 2
target:
1) Iron Man
 2) The Incredible Hulk
 3) Iran Man 2
description: Convert a list to be numbered
hint: C-v to select bullet points then c1) to replace with 1

name: Format table
starting:
name   course  item    comment
Troy   Main    Lasagna
Steve  Side    Greek salad Not vegan!
Barbara Anne    Drinks  Punch   A really long comment
description: Formatting text into a table
hint: Lots of work with Visual Block mode

name: Asserts in a list
starting: assert lines[0] == 'blah'
target:
assert lines[0] == 'blah'
assert lines[1] == 'bleh'
assert lines[2] == 'bluh'
assert lines[3] == 'blih'
assert lines[4] == 'blyh'
description: Add test cases for a python list of strings
hint: Make a macro to copy the line, paste, and increment with yypC-a

name: Split arguments over lines
starting: samtools view -f 3 -F 3584 -L chr1.bed -o filtered_reads.sam -U removed_reads.sam mouse_reads.bam
target:
samtools view \
  -f 3 \
  -F 3584 \
  -L chr1.bed \
  -o filtered_reads.sam \
  -U removed_reads.sam \
  mouse_reads.bam
description: Splitting a long command with many arguments over multiple lines
hint: I would do this with a combination of forward-to-space followed by typing the , going to the line with enter then going back to normal mode, and using ; to repeat the movement twice, then . to repeat the command, indenting etc. might need to do a final indenting after the first line, this becomes ;;.;;.;;.
